alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 29 at 8:25PM CDT until March 29 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN...EASTERN JEFFERSON...DOUGLAS AND EAST CENTRAL OSAGE COUNTIES... At 823 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lewis And Clark Village to 4 miles southwest of Tonganoxie to 5 miles west of Centropolis, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 8:15pm, trained weather spotter reported quarter size hail 4 miles west of Overbrook. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lawrence, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Oskaloosa, Eudora, Overbrook, Lyndon, Centropolis, McLouth, Pomona, Lecompton, Clinton, Winchester, Lone Star, Pleasant Grove, Vinland, Williamstown, Pomona Lake, Clinton Lake and Globe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 188 and 192. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 193 and 205. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
